intro: Huperzia crebra, commonly known as the crested huperzia, is a species of moss-like plant belonging to the family Huperziaceae. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and dark green, leathery foliage. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. Huperzia crebra has spore-producing structures called sporophytes, which are borne on the upper surface of its leaves. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
